name: Color Center-Surround
comment: These units look for one color in the center, and another color surrounding it. These units are likely have many subelties about the range of hues, texture preferences, and interactions that similar neurons in earlier layers may not have.

name: Complex Center-Surround
comment: This is a broad, not very well defined category for center-surround units that detect a pattern or complex texture in their center.

name: Brightness Gradients
comment: These units detect brightness gradients. This is their third iteration.

name: Generic, Oriented Fur
comment: We don't typically think of fur as an oriented feature, but it is. These units detect fur parting in various ways, much like how hair on your head parts.

name: Eyes
comment: Again, we continue to see eye detectors quite early in vision. Note that these detect eyes that are slightly larger in scale than the ones in the previous layer. In the next layer, we see much larger scale eye detectors again.

name: Boundary
comment: These units use multiple cues to detect the bounadries of objects. They vary in oreintation, detecting convex/concave/straight boundaries, and detecting articial vs fur foregrounds. Cues they rely on include line detectors, high-low frequency detectors, and color contrast.

name: Curves
comment: The third iteration of curve detectors. They detect larger radii curves than their predecessors, and are the first to not lsightly fire for curves rotated 180 degrees. A detailed article on these is forthcoming.

name: Double Curves
comment: Weights appear to be two curve detectors added together. Likely best thought of as a polysemantic neuron.

name: Curve Shapes
comment: Simple shapes created by composing curves, such as spirals and S-curves.

name: Divots
comment: Curve-like detectors for sharp corners or bumps.

name: Evolute
comment: Detects curves facing away from the middle. Weights are the opposite of a circle detector.

name: Circles / Loops
comment: Piece together curves in a circle or partial circle. Opposite of evolute.

name: Proto-Head
comment: The tiny eye detectors, along with texture detectors for fur, hair and skin developed at the previous layer enable these early head detectors, which will continue to be refined in the next layer.
